name: Vibrio nigripulchritudo str. SFn1
description: V. nigripulchritudo is responsible for mass mortalities of shrimp in New Caledonia. The analysis of the genome sequence of one strain; SFn1 (realized by the Genoscope); genetic approaches and molecular epidemiology led us to suggest that plasmids and chromosomal elements played a role in the emergence of a pathogenic lineage. Through genome sequencing of 15 additional strains this project will yield insight into the key features underlying virulence; and will investigate whether horizontal gene acquisitions have driven the differentiation of virulent lineages.
